topic.title: db.createCS()

section.title: db.createCS(<name>,[pageSize])
section.p: Create a collection space in a database instance.

strow.stentry: Collection space name. Collection space names should be unique to each other in a database object.
Size of data page. The default value is 4096B.

section.title: Format
section.p: Users can create a collection space with 2 parameters: name and pageSize.The parameter "name" is in the type of string. The parameter "pageSize" is in the type of 32-bit integer

ul.li: The parameter "name" should not be null string. It should not contain "." or "$". The length of it should not be greater than 127B.
Collection space names should be unique to each other in a database object.
When creating a collection space, users can specify the size of data page. It is unchangable afterward. The default value of it is 4096B.

li.p: Create a collection space named "foo" without specifying the size of data page.
Create a collection space named "foo" and specify the size of data page as 1024.

topic.title: db.dropCS()

section.title: db.dropCS(<name>)
section.p: Delete a specified collection space in a database instance.

strow.stentry: Collection space name. All the collection sapces in a database instance is unique to each other.

section.title: Format
section.p: The parameter "name" should be specified in the method "dropCS()". The type of collection space name should be string. It should be ensured that the collcection space name exists in the database instance, or operation exception will occur.

ul.li: The value of "name" should not be null string. It should not contain "." or "$". And the length of it should not be greater than 127B. If the collection space name is invalid , the operation will fail.
It should be ensured that the collection space name exists, or exception will occur.

li.p: Supposing that a collection space called "foo" exists, the following command will delete it.

topic.title: db.list()

section.title: db.list(<listType>,[con],[sel],[sort])
section.p: Enumerate list. List is a lightweight command to get the current system status.Click here to learn more about list.

strow.stentry: List type. The value of it is in the range from 0 to 7.
Selecting condition. It just returns the records that match conditions in "con". When it is null, return all records.
Select fields to be returned. When it is null, return all records.
Sort records. "1" means ascending order. "-1" means descending order.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "list()" contians 4 parameters: listType, con, sel and sort. The parameter "listType" is in the type of enumeration. Other parameters are in the type of json object. The format is as follow:
section.codeblock: {"listType":"<List type>",["con":"{"field name 1":{"operator 1":"value 1"},"field name 2":{"operator 2":"value 2"}...}"],["sel":"{"field name 1":"","field name 2":"",...}"],["sort":"{"field name 1":-1|1,"field name 2":1|-1,...}"]}

ul.li: The value of "listType" is in the range from 0 to 7.

The value of "sel" is in the type of json object. The value of each field in it is always null string. If it is specified as "{"field name 1": "value 1", "field name 2":"value 2",...}", the values of existing fields are invalid. As for fields that doesn't exist, it will return "{"field name 1": "value 1", "field name 2":"value 2",...}".
If a value of a field is in the type of array, users can use "." to invoke it and add double quotation.

li.p: Specify the value of "listType" as 0db.list(0)
Return
Specify the value of "listType" as 6db.list(6)
Return
Return records that contains the value of "Logical" greater than 1. Each record just return the 2 fields: Name and ID. The values of "Name" in these records are in ascending order.

section.title: db.snapshot(<snapType>,[con],[sel],[sort])
section.p: It lists snapshots. Snapshot is a kind of command used to get the current status of system.Click here to learn more about snapshot.

strow.stentry: Snapshot type, the value of snapshot type is in the range from 0 to 7.
Selectable condition. It just returns records that matches the value of "con". If it is null, it returns all records.
Select returned field name. If it is null, return all the fields
Sort records according to specified field. "1" means ascending order. "-1" means descending order.

section.title: Format
section.p: The defination of the method "snapshot()" contains four fields: listTypeconselsort. The type of "listType" is enumeration. Other fields are json objects. The format is as follow:

ul.li: The value of snapType is in the range from 0 to 7.

The parameter "sel" is a json object. The value of field name is specified as null string. It is defined as: {"Field name 1":"value 1","Field name 2":"value 2",...}.If the records contain the specified field names, the values are invalid. If the records don't contain specified fields, it returns "{"Field name 1":"value 1", "Field name 2":"value 2"}".
If the value of a field is in the type of array. We invoke the elements in it through "." and double quotations.

li.p: Set the value of "snapType" as 0:db.snapshot(0)
Returns context snapshot:
Return records that contain the value of "Contexts.0.ContextID" equal to 0, and just return values in the 2 field, SessiomID and Contexts.StartTimestamp. The returned records are in ascending order:

topic.title: db.collectionspace.createCL()

section.title: db.collectionspace.createCL(<name>,[options])
section.p: Create a collection in a specified collection space. Collection is a logical object which stores records. Each record should belong to on and only one collection.

strow.stentry: Collection name. Collection names should be unique to each other in a collection space.
when create collection,you can set other properties about the collection through the param options,such as assigning the ShardingKey or whether storing the data in compressed form.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "createCL()" contains 2 parameters: name and shardingkey. The value of "name" is a string, which should not be null. the param options be used to set other properties for the collection,at present,you can set the following properties by the options:
(1)ShardingKey: a json form param,the format is:{ShardingKey:{field name1:1|-1,field name2:1|-1,...}}
(2)copy number: a json form param,the format is:{ReplSize:<int num>}
(3)data commpressed:a json form param,the format is:{Compressed:true|false}

ul.li: The parameter "shardingkey" is a JSON object. Each of the fields in the JSON object corresponds to that in shard key. The value is 1 or -1, representing ascending and descending order.

The parameter "ReplSize" is a JSON object,the value of it is a int type,Be used to set the number of writed data nodes,it's value must be in the range of 7 or less.For example,supposing there are four data nodes in the cluster,set {ReplSize:2},then two data nodes will write success;but if set {ReplSize:4}(or 567),then all the data nodes will write success.

The parameter "Compressed" is a JSON object,the value of it is boolean type,if the value is "true",then standing for the data of the collection will be stored in compressed form ,otherwise,data will be stored in normal .
when the options have one or more params,please use comma(,) to separate.
The value of "name" should not be null string, "." or "$". The length of it should not be greater than 127B, or exception will occur.

li.p: Create collection "bar" in collection space "foo" without shard key. If the collection space "foo" doesn't exist, it will automatically generate collection space "foo".
Create collection "bar" in collection space "foo" with the shard key "age" and in ascending order.

strow.stentry: Collection name. Collection names should be unique to each other in a collection space.

section.title: Format

ul.li: The value of "name" should not be null string. It should not contain "." or "$". And the length of it should not be greater than 127B. If the collection name is invalid , the operation will fail.
It should be ensured that the collection name exists in a collection space, or exception will occur.

li.p: Supposing that the collection "bar" exists in the collection space "foo", the following command will delete it.

Make sure that the collection name exists in the collection space, or operation exception will occur.

li.p: Supposing that the collection name "bar", the command returns the quotation of the collection "bar" in the collection space "foo".

topic.title: db.collectionspace.collection.insert()

section.title: db.collectionspace.collection.insert(<doc|docs>,[flag])
section.p: Insert records into specified collection. If collection space or collection doesn't exist, please create a new collection space. For example, the command "db.createCS("foo")" creates a new collection space named "foo". Then create a new collection in collection space. For instance, the command "db.foo.createCL("bar")" creates a collection named "bar" under the collection space "foo" so that users can insert data into the collection "bar".

strow.stentry: Document record. The parameter "doc" means one record. The parameter "docs" means more than one record.

The paremeter "flag" means whether the value of "_id" should be showed. The value of it is 0 or 1. The default value is 0, which means it doesn't need to show the value of "_id". 1 means it needs to show the value of "_id".

section.title: Format
section.p: The definition of "insert()" contains two fields: doc|docs and flag. The parameter "doc|docs" is in the type of JSON object. The parameter "flag" is in the type of Boolean of javascript. The value of "flag" is 0 or 1.
doc{ {"< field name 1>":"< value >","< field name 2>":"< value >",}[,"flag":<0|1>] }

ul.li: If the value of "_id" is not specified in a record that is about to be inserted, the system will generate the value of "_id" automatically to ensure the uniqueness of the record.

li.p: Insert a record without the value of "_id".
This operation inserts a new record into collection "bar". In this record, the value of "name" is "Tom", and the value of "age" is 20. The value of "_id" is uniquely generated:
Insert a record that contains the value of "_id".
This operatin inserts a new record into the collection "bar". The value of "_id" is 10. The value of "age" is 20:
Insert more than one record.
This operation will insert 2 records into the collection "bar":
1)In the first record, the value of "_id" is 20. The value of "name" is "Mike". The value of "age" is 15.
2)In the second record, teh value of "_id" is generated by the system. The value of "name" is "John". The value of "age" is 25. The value of "phone" is 123.

topic.title: db.collectionspace.collection.count()

section.title: db.collectionspace.collection.count([cond])
section.p: Return the total amount of records in a specified collection in a collection space.

strow.stentry: Selecting condition. If it is null, it will count all the records in the collection. If it is not null, it will count records that match the conditions.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "count()" contains field named "cond". It is a JSON object.

li.p: Count all the records in collection "bar" without specifying "cond".
Count records that contain the value "Tom" on the field "name" and the value on the field "age" greater than 25.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: db.collectionspace.collection.find()

section.title: db.collectionspace.collection.find([cond],[sel])
section.p: The method "find()" selects records that users need. It will return a cursor. In Sequoiadb, a cursor is a pointer which point to a query result set. The client can go through teh query results.

strow.stentry: Selecting condtion. If it is null, it will find all the records. If it is not null, it will find records that matches the condition.
It chooses fields to be returned. If it is null, it will return all the records.If a field doesn't exist, it will return null string.

section.title: Format
section.p: The definitin of "find()" contains 2 parameters: cond and sel, which are both in the type of JSON object. The parameter "cond" specifys the matching condition. The parameter "sel" specifys the fields to be returned.

note.p: The parameter "sel" is in the type of a json object. The value of the field is null string. But if it is specified as :{"field name 1":"value 1","field name 2":"value 2",...} and records conain choosed field, the values are invalid. If fields specified in "sel" don't exist, it will return "{"field name 1":"value 1","field name 2":"value 2",...}".

li.p: Find all the records without specifying the field "cond" and "sel".
Find records that matches the value of the parameter "cond".
This operation will return records that contains the value of "age" greater than 25 and the value "Tom" on the field "name".
Specify the fields to return by setting the content of the parameter "sel".For example, there are 2 records: "{age:25,type:"system"}" and "{age:20,name:"Tom",type:"normal"}".
This operation return the value of "age" and "name". So it will return:"{age:25,name:""}{age:20,name:"Tom"}". Although the first record doesn't contain the field, it will return "name:""".

topic.title: db.collectionspace.collection.remove()

section.title: db.collectionspace.collection.remove([cond],[hint])
section.p: Delete record in a collection

strow.stentry: Selectable condition. If it is null, it will delete all the records. If it is not null, delete records that match the condition.

section.title: Format
section.p: The "cond" is a json object. When it is null ( For example, "{}".), delete all records in the collection. "hint" is a json object that contains a single element. The field name of this element is ignored. But the value of the field in it is specified as the name of index which is needed to visit. When the value of field is null, it will visit all the records in the collection.

li.p: Delete all the records in the collection "bar".
Delete records that match the condition in "cond" according to visit plan.
This manipulation visits records in a collection named "bar" according to the index named "myIndex" and delete records which contains the value of "age" greater than 20.

topic.title: db.collectionspace.collection.createIndex()

section.title: db.collectionspace.collection.createIndex(<name>,<indexDef>,[isUnique])
section.p: Create index in a collection to accelerate query.

strow.stentry: Index name. It should be unique in a collection.
Index key. It contains one or more objects that specify index fields and order direction. "1" means ascending order. "-1" means descending order.
It shows whether the index is unique. The default value is "false". When it is "true", the index is unique.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "createIndex()" contains three parameters: "name", "indexDef" and "isUnique". The value of "name" should be in the type of string. The field "indexDef" is defined as a JSON object, which contains at least one field. The field name is index name. The value of it is 1 or -1. "1" means ascending order. "-1" means descending order. The parameter "isUnique" is in the type of bool. Its default value is "false".

ul.li: Values on the field that an unique index specified should not be the same in defferent records.
Index name should not be null string. It should not contain "." or "$". The length of it should not be lesser than 127B.

li.p: Create an unique index named "ageIndex" on the field "age" in collection "bar". The records are in ascending order on the field "age".

section.title: db.collectionspace.collection.getIndex(<name>)
section.p: Return the quotation of specified index.

strow.stentry: Index name, all the index name in a collection should be unique to each other.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "getIndex()" contains the field "name", which is in the type of string.

ul.li: It should be ensured that the index name exists in the collection before users get index quotation.
Index name should not contain null string, "." or "$". The length of it should not be greater than 127B.

li.p: Supposing that the index "ageIndex" exists in collection "bar", the following command will return the quotation of it.

topic.title: db.collectionspace.collection.update()

section.title: db.collectionspace.collection.update(<rule>,[cond],[hint])
section.p: Update records in a collection.

strow.stentry: Update rule. Records will be updated according the value of "rule".
Selecting condition. If it is null, update all the records. If it is not null, it will update records that match the condition.
It specify the visiting plan by giving an index.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "update()" should contains the field "rule". It is a json object. The parameter "cond" and "hint" are selectable. The parameter "hint"
contains one json object that contains one field. The "name" in this field is ignored, but the value specify the index to visit records. When the value is
null, it will visit all the records in the collection. The format is "{"":null}" or "{"":"<indexname>"}".

p.codeblock: {<{""Update character 1"":{field name 1:"value"},"Update character 2":{"field name 2":"value 2"},...}>,[{"field name 1":{"match 1":"value 1"},"field name 2":{"match 2":"value 2"},...}],[{"":"Index name"|null}]}

li.p: Update all the records according to the updating rule. That's to say, we merely set the value of "rule", but not "cond" or "hint".
This operation updates the field "age" in collection "bar" by adding 1 to the value of "age".
Select records that match the condition. Update these records according to update rules by setting the values of "rule" and "cond".
This operation will update records that contains the field "age" but not the field "name" in collection "bar" and delete the field "age" in these records.
Update records according to visiting plan, supposing that the collection contains the specified index name.
This operation visit records that contains the value of "age" greater than 20 in the collection "bar" through the index "testIndex". Add 1 to the field of "age".

topic.title: db.collectionspace.collection.upsert()

section.title: db.collectionspace.collection.upsert(<rule>,[cond],[hint])
section.p: Update collection records. The method "upsert" and the method "update" are used to update records. But when no records is
matched according to the parameter "cond", "update" does nothing, but "upset" will insert data once.

strow.stentry: Update rule. It will update record according to the value of "rule".
Selectable condition. When it is null, update all the records. If it is not null, update records that match the condition in "cond".

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "upsert()" should contians the parameter "rule". The parameter "rule" is a json object. The parameters "cond"
and "hint" are selectable.The parameter "cond" and "hint" are selectable. The parameter "hint"
contains one json object that contains one field. The "name" in this field is ignored, but the value specify the index to visit records. When the value is
null, it will visit all the records in the collection. The format is "{"":null}" or "{"":"<indexname>"}".

p.codeblock: {<{""Update character 1"":{"Field name 1":"value"},"Update character 2":{"Field name 2":"value 2"},...}>,[{"Field name 1":{"match 1":"value 1"},"field name 2":{"match 2":"value 2"},...}],[{"":"index name "|null}]}

section.title: Sample
section.p: Supposing that there are 2 records in the collection "bar".

li.p: Update all the records according to the updating rule. That's to say, we merely set the value of "rule", but not "cond" or "hint".

This operation is equivalent to that of the method "update()". It updates all the records in the collection ''bar". It adds 1 to the value of "age" and changes the value of "name" into "Mike". If a record doesn't contain the field "name", "$set" will insert the field of "name" and its value into it and return with the method "find".
Update all the records according to the updating rule. That's to say, we set the value of "rule", "cond" and "hint".
Update records according to visiting plan, supposing that the index name "testIndex" exists in the collection.

topic.title: cousor.sort()

section.title: cousor.sort(<sort>)
section.p: Sort result set according to a specified field.

strow.stentry: Sort result set according to a specified field. The value of it is 1 or -1. 1 represents ascending order. -1 represents descending order.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "cousor.sort()" contains a parameter called "sort". It is a json object. If it is not specified, result set will not be sorted.
The format is as follow:

li.p: Return records that contains the value of "age" greater than 20. And it just return the fields named "name" and "age" in them with ascending order on the field "age".

note.p: Through the method "find()", we can select the fields we need. In the example above, it returns "age" and "name", so it we use "sort()" to sort the records, we can only sort according to "age" and "name". If we don't specify the parameter "sel" in the method "find", we can sort the records according to any field.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "cursor.hint()" contains parameter "hint". If it is not specified, the query will not use index to visit records.
The parameter "hint" contain a one-field json object. The field name is ignored. But the field value is specified as the index
which will be visited. When it is null, it will visit all the records in the collection.

topic.title: cursor.limit()

section.title: cursor.limit(<num>)
section.p: Set the maximum amount of records in result set.

strow.stentry: The parameter "num" sets the maximum amount of records in result set.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "cousor.limit()" contains the parameter "num". It is in the type of "int". If the value of "num" is not specified, it will return all the records in the result set. If users need the first 5 records, the value of "num"should be set as 5.

li.p: Select records with the value of "age" greater than 10 in the collection "bar" and return the first 10 records.

note.p: If the amount of records in the result set is lesser than 10, it will return all the records. It it is greater than 10, it will return the first 10 records.

topic.title: cursor.skip()

section.title: cursor.skip(<num>)
section.p: It is used to specify the first returned record.

strow.stentry: Specify the amount of records in returned result set.

section.title: Format
section.p: The method "cousor.skip()" contains the parameter "num". It is in the type of "int". If the value of "num" is null, or it is 0, the method will return the whole result set.
If you want to get a result set that begin with the 3rd record, you should set the value of "num" as "2".

li.p: Select records with the value of "age" greater than 10 and return records which begin with the 5th record. That's to say, it will skip the fisrt 4 records.

note.p: If the amount of records in a result set is lesser than 5, no record will be returned. If the amount of records in a result set is greater than 5, it will return records which starts with the 5th record.

topic.title: Operator

strow.stentry: Add specified value to the value of specified field.
Set the value of specified field as specified value.
Delete specified field in an object.
If the element to add doesn't exist in the array, the command add it, or it will be ignored. The target field should be array.
Delete the last N value in an array
Delete the last N value in an array. The target field should be array.(If N is lesser than 0, it will delete the first N elements in the array.)
Delete the specified value in a target array. The target field should be array.
Delete all the values of a speficied array in a target array. The target field should be array.
Insert a value into a target array. The target field should be array.
Insert all the values in a specified array into a target array. The target field should be array.

note.p: In sequoiaDB, the structure called JSON (field name: value) is used to express "=".Of course , you can use $et operator.
Sample:
db.collectionspace.collection.find({a:42})
This command find records that contains the value of "a" equal to 42.

topic.title: $gt

section.title: Description
section.p: "$gt" finds records that contain value greater than the specific value "value" on the field "field name".

li.p: Find records that contains value greater than 20 on the field "age" in the collection "bar" of the collection space "foo".

ul.li: When "$gt" manipulates records with nested objects, the functionupdate() will update records that contains "age" value of 25 with records which conatins a "type" value greater than 2 under the field "service".db.foo.bar.update({$set:{age:25}},{"service.type":{$gt:2}})

ul.li: When "$lte" manipulates records with nested objects, the functionupdate() will update records that contains "age" value of 25 with records which conatins a "type" value greater than or euqivalent to 2 under the field "service".db.foo.bar.update({$set:{age:25}},{"service.type":{$gte:2}})

topic.title: $in

section.title: Description
section.p: "$in" finds records that match any value of the array ([<value 1>,<value 2>,...<value N>]) on the field ("field name") within a collection. If the field ("field name") is in the type of array, records that match any value of the array ([<value 1>,<value 2>,...<value N>]) on the field ("field name").

section.title: Sample

li.p: Find records with "age" value of 20 or 25 in the collection "bar":
When manipulating "$in" on array fields, the following expression finds records with "name" value of "Tom" or "Mike" in the collection "bar", then deletes the field of "age" in these records.

section.note: Array containing one value like {<field name>:{$in:[<value>]}} equals {<field name>:<value>}.

topic.title: $nin

section.title: Description
section.p: "$nin" finds records that match none of the values in the array ([<value 1>,<value 2>,...<value N>]) on the field ("field name") within a collection. If the field ("field name") is in the type of array, records containing elements that match any value of the array ([<value 1>,<value 2>,...<value N>]) on the field ("field name").

li.p: Find records without the field "age" or the value of 20 or 25 on the field "age" in the collection "bar":

When manipulating "$nin" on array fields, the following expression finds records without the field "name" or the value of "Tom" or "Mike" on the field "name" in the collection "bar", then deletes the field of "age" in these records.

note.p: Array containing one value like {<field name>:{$in:[<value>]}} equals {<field name>:<value>}.

topic.title: $all

section.title: Description
section.p: Manipulation "$all" is manipulated on field names in type of Array. It will find records that contains all the values in the specified array ([<value 1>,<value 2>,...<value N>]) on the specified field ("<field name>").

li.p: Find records that contain "Tom" and "Mike" on the specified field "name" in the collection "bar":
As a result, the system will match records that contains the field "name" and "name" values as follow in the collection "bar":
But the record below won't be matched:

note.p: When "$all" is manipulated on a field not in type of array, for example: "db.foo.bar.find(age:{$all:[20]})" equals to "db.foo.bar.find({age:20})".

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: $and

section.title: Description
section.p: $and is a logical manipulation. It is aimed at searching for records that satisfies all the expressions (<expression 1><expression 2>,...,<expression N>).
But if the result of the1st expression (<expression 1>) is false, SequoiaDB will ignore all the expressions afterward.

li.p: Find records with "age" value of 20 and "price" value of less than 10 in collection "bar":

note.p: Sequoiadb provides implicit "and" manipulation: separeate expressions with ",". For example,

li.p: When "and" is manipulated on the same field like {age{$lt:20}}and{age:{$exists:1}}, then we can use "$and" to manipulate the two separated expressions, or combine them: {age:{$lt:20,$exists:1}}.

When the results of 2 manipulations are the same, it will find records containing the field "age" with the "age" value of less than 20 in collection bar, then add 200 to the "salary" value of these records.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: $not

section.title: Description
section.p: The opration "$not" is a logcal "not". It select records that don't match "(<expression 1><expression 2>,...,<expression N>)".

li.p: Select records that contains the value of "age" unequal to 20 or the value of "price" equal to or greater than 10.

topic.title: $or

section.title: Description
section.p: The operation "$or" is a logical "or" operation. It returns "true" when a record matches one expresson of the expression group (<expression 1>,<expression 2>,...,<expression N>).
Once the result is "true", the matched record will be returned.

li.p: Select records that contain the value "Tom" on the field "name", and the value 20 on the field "age" or the value of "price" lesser than 10.

Apply "$or" in nested fields. The following command will select records that contains the value of "age" lesser than 20 or the value "system" on the field "type" which is nested in the field "snapshot", and use $incto update the value of "salary" in these records.

Find records that do not contain object "content" with the field "name" in collection "bar".

return all records in the collection bar where the value of first element is "china" and the value of second element is "ABC" in the array add.

topic.title: Update Operator

strow.stentry: add the given value to the value of specified field
set the given value to the specified field
delete the specified field of object
if the given element doesn't exist in the array,then added,otherwise skipped.the object field must be array type
pull the last of N values in the array
pull the last of N values in the array,the object field must be array type(if N less than 0 means that delete the first of -N values from the beginning of array).
pull the specified value from the object arraythe object element must be array.
pull each of the elements in the specified array from the object array.the object element must be array type.
push the value to the object array,the object element must be array type.
push each of values in the specified array to the object array,the object element must be array type.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: {$inc:{<field name1>:<value1>,<field name2>:<value2>,...}}

section.title: Description
section.p: $inc operation is to increase the specified "<value>" for the specified "<field name>".If these is no specified field name,then add the field name and value to the record; If the specified field name exist in records, then the value of the specified field name will plus the specified value.

li.p: select records in the collection bar where the field name age has the value greate than 15, then update them, the value of filed name age will increase 5 ,and the value of field name ID will increase 1.
select records in the collection bar where the field name arr existed and is array type,and set the value of second element to increase 1.

topic.title: $addtoset

section.title: Grammar
section.p: {$addtoset:{<field name1>:[<value1>,<value2>,...,<valueN>]<field name2>:[<value1>,<value2>,...,<valueN>],...}}

section.title: Description
section.p: $addtoset is to add element and value to the array object, the operation object must be array type field.$addtoset has the following rule:

ul.li:
the records have the specified fields(<field name1>,<field name2>...).
if the specified values([<vaule1>,<value2>,...,<valueN>])exist in the records, skipping with no operations, only add values that doesn't exist to the target array.

li.p: the records doesn't exist the specified field name.
If the records itself doesn't exist the specified field name(<field name1>,<field name2>...), then add the specified field names and values to the records.
the records exist in the target array object. As the follwoing record:{arr:[1,2,4],age:10,name:"Tom"}

after this operation, the record update as{arr:[1,2,4,3,5],age:10,name:"Tom"}.in the previous record , these is no 3 or 5 element in the array object arr,after using $addtoset operator,update them to arr.
the records don't exist in the specified array object,as the following record:{name:"Mike",age:12}

after this operation,the record update as:{arr:[1,3,5],age:10,name:"Tom"}.in the previous record,these is no array object arr,after using $addtoset operator,update the array object arr and it's elements to the record.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: $pop

section.title: Grammar
section.p: {$pop:{<field name1>:<N>,<field name2>:<N>,...}}

section.title: Description
section.p: $pop operation is to delete the last of N elements in the array object(<field name1>,<field name2>,...), the operation object must be array type.If the records don't exist the specified array object,skipping with no operations;if N is greate than the length of array object,then the length of array object update to zero,that is all of the element will drop;if N is less than zero,means to delete the first of -N elements from the begining of array object.

li.p: delete the last two of elements from the array object arr in the collection bar.As the following record:{arr:[1,2,3,4],age:20,name:"Tom"}
after this operation,the record update as:{arr:[1,2],age:20,name:"Tom"}
delete the last ten of elements from the array object arr in the collection bar.as the following record:{arr:[1,2,3,4],age:20,name:"Tom"}
after this operation,the record update as:{arr:[],age:20,name:"Tom"}
after this operation,the record update as:{arr:[3,4],age:20,name:"Tom"}

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: $pull

section.title: Description
section.p: $pull operation is to delete the specified values(<value1>,<field name2>:<value2>,...) from the given array object field(<field name1>,<field name2>), the operation object must be array type field. If the specified array object don't exist in record,skipping with no operations; If the specified values don't exist in array object, also skipping with no operations.

li.p: after this operation,the record update as:{arr[1,4,5],age:10,name:["Mike"]}
after this operation,the record update as:{arr[1,3,4,5],age:10,name:["Mike"]}. As these is no element which has the value 2 in the array object arr ,so object arr have no change.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: $pull_all

section.title: Description
section.p: $pull_all is to pull the given values([<value1>,<value2>,...,<valueN>]) of the specified array object(<field name1>),the operation object must be array type field.
if the specified array object exist in the records,skipping with no operations; if the specified values don't exist in array object,nor do any operation.

li.p: delete the elements which have the value 2 or 3 from the array object arr and have the value "Tom" from array object name in the collection bar, as the following record:{arr[1,2,4,5],age:10,name:["Tom","Mike"]}
after this operation,the record update as:{arr[1,4,5],age:10,name:["Mike"]}
after this operation,the record update as:{arr[1,3],age:10,name:["Tom","Mike"]}.

topic.title: SQL Grammar

body.p: Sequoiadb is a document-oriented type of non-relational database, this section mainly descibes how to use SQL to access and process data in the Sequoiadb system.
body.note: in the sequoiaDB,SQL statement is not case sensitive.

strow.stentry: db.exec("select dept_nocount(emp_no) as from foo.bar group by dept_no ")
db.exec("select * from foo.bar order by age desc")
limit the number of return records
set the number of records skipped

li.p: create collectionspace foo

<cl_name>collection name.the length of it can't exceed 127B,and collection name can't be empty string,and can't exist same collection name in a collectionspace.

li.p: create collection bar in the collectionspace foo

<cl_name>collection name. collection name also must be in the collectionsapce.

li.p: The following sample will drop the collection bar in the collectionspace foo.

topic.title: sql create index

section.title: create index
section.p: Be used to create index in the collections.in the case of without reading collection,indexes enable database application to find data faster.

section.title: Grammer
section.p: [unique]TO logo if the created index is unique.unique index means that the same field name can't have the same index name.
<index_name>index name
<cs_name>collectionspace name
<cl_name>collection name
field1_namefield name where create index , with an index name can be created on multiple fields.
[asc|desc]sort, asc stand for ascending index the value of a field.desc stand for descending index the value of a field.the default is asc.

ul.li:
the following sample will create a unique index on the field age.
db.execUpdate("create unique index test_name on foo.bar (age)")

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <index_name>index name
<cs_name>collectionspace name
<cl_name>collection name

li.p: The following sample will drop the index name "test_index" in the collectionspace foo,collection bar.Assume the index name is already exist.

p.codeblock: db.execUpdate("drop index test_index on foo.bar") //Equivalent db.foo.bar.dropIndex("test_index")

topic.title: sql insert into

section.title: insert into
section.p: Be used to insert new records to the collection.

section.title: Grammar

p.codeblock: insert into <cs_name>.<cl_name>(<field1_name,field2_name,...>) values(<value1,value2,...>) or insert into <cs_name>.<cl_name> values(<select_set>)

section.p: <cs_name>collectionspace name
<cl_name>collection name
<field_name>field name
<value>values the field name corresponding
<select_set>query result set

li.p: This sample will insert one record to the collection bar,field names are age and name,corresponding values are 25 and "Tom".

ul.li: This sample will insert batch records to the collection bar,these records is the result set select from collection small.db.execUpdate("insert into foo.bar values(select * from big.small)")

topic.title: sql select

section.title: select
section.p: Be used to select data from collection,the result will be storage as a result set.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <cs_name>collectionspace name
<cl_name>collection name
<field_name>field name

li.p: This sample will return the select field name.if a match record doesnot contain the specified field name,then return null value .

note.p: 1.you can select likewheregroup byorder bylimitoffsetkeywords to select those records you want.
2.if the query source is not collection,then all the field name in this layer query need to use alias (* except)
example:select T.a , T.b from (select * from foo.bar) as T where T.a<10
3.subquery must use alias.the alias appear in subquery only act on upper layer.

section.title: update
section.p: Be used to modify records in the collection.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <cs_name>collectionspace name
<cl_name>collection name
<condition>condition,only update the records match the condition.

li.p: This sample will modify all the records in the collection,the value of field name age will be update 20,if a records doesnot contain feild age,then 'age:20' will be add to the record.

ul.li: This sample will be modify the match records,only update the records that satisfy the condition age<10.db.execUpdate("update foo.bar set age=20 where age<10")

section.p: Be used to delete records in the collection.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <cs_name>collectionspace name
<cl_name>collection name
<condition>condition,only delete the records which match the condition.

li.p: This sample will delete all the records in the collection.

ul.li: This sample will delete the records which match the condition age<10.db.execUpdate("delete from foo.bar where age<10")

section.title: group by
section.p: Be used to group result set According to one or more filed name combined with aggragate function.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <field_name>field name
[asc|desc]sort, asc stand for ascending,desc stand for descending. default asc.

li.p: Calculating the number of employees in each department and group by the field name dept_no.

p.codeblock: db.exec("select dept_nocount(emp_no) as from foo.bar group by dept_no")

note.p: likesumcountminmaxavgthese counting function must use alias.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)

section.title: order by
section.p: Be used to sort the result set according to the specified field name,default asc.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <field_name>field name
[asc|desc]sort, asc stand for ascending,desc stand for descending. default asc

li.p: To count the number employees in each department ,and group by the feild name dept_no,and sort in desc order by the field name.

p.codeblock: db.exec("select dept_nocount(emp_no) as from foo.bar group by dept_no order by dept_no desc")

note.p: likesumcountminmaxavg these counting function must use alias.

section.title: limit
section.p: Be used to limit the number of returned records.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <limit_num>limit number

li.p: This sample will return the first 10 records from the result set.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)

section.title: offset
section.p: Be used to set the number of skipped records.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <offset_num>the number of skipped records

li.p: This sample will skip the first five records,then return from the sixth record.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: sql as

section.title: As
section.p: Be used to specify alias for the collections or field names.

section.title: Grammar
section.p: <cs_name>collectionspace name
<cl_name>collection name
select_setresult set
field_namefield name
<alias_name>:alias name

li.p: specify alias for collection

p.codeblock: db.exec("select T1.age,T1.name from foo.bar as T1 where T1.age>10")

ul.li:
specify alias for field
db.exec("select age as from foo.bar where age>10")
specify alias for result set db.exec("select T.age,T.name from (select age,name from foo.bar) as T where T.age>10")

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: sql inner join

section.title: inner join
section.p: According to two or more collections in the relationship between the field name,inner join is used to query data from those collections.

li.p: There have employee information table foo.emp and depatmenrt information table foo.dept, query the employee number filed emp_no in which department name field dept_name.

p.codeblock: db.exec("select E.emp_no,D.dept_name from foo.emp as E inner join foo.dept as D on E.dept_no=D.dept_no")

note.p: 1.can't contain non-union conditions,the following is a wrong way.

p.codeblock: select T1.a,T2.b from foo.bar1 as T1 inner join foo.bar2 as T2 on T1.a<10

note.p: 2.can't use 'select *' statement in join layer.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: sql left outer join

section.title: left outer join
section.p: left outer join will return all the records from the left collection name(collection1_name),even though there is no matched records in the right collection name(collection2_name).

p.codeblock: <collection1_name | (select_set1) as <alias1_name> left outer join <collection2_name | (select_set2)> as <alias2_name> [ON condition]

li.p: There have employee information table foo.emp and depatmenrt information table foo.dept, query the employee number filed emp_no in which department name field dept_name.

p.codeblock: db.exec("select E.emp_no,D.dept_name from foo.emp as E left outer join foo.dept as D on E.dept_no=D.dept_no where D.dept_no<4")

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: sql right outer join

section.title: right outer join
section.p: right outer join will return all the records from the right collection name(collection2_name),even though there is no matched records in the left collection name(collection1_name).

p.codeblock: <collection1_name | (select_set1) as <alias1_name> right outer join <collection2_name | (select_set2)> as <alias2_name> [ON condition]

li.p: There have employee information table foo.emp and depatmenrt information table foo.dept, query the employee number filed emp_no<10 in which department name field dept_name.

p.codeblock: db.exec("select E.emp_no,D.dept_name from foo.emp as E right outer join foo.dept as D on E.dept_no=D.dept_no where E.emp_no<10")

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: sql sum()

section.title: sum()
section.p: Be used to sum for the specified field name.

section.title: Grammar
section.note:
1.when use sum() function,you must use aliases.
2.automatically skipped for the non-numeric field.

li.p: This sample will sum for the field name age in the collection bar.

topic.title: Mapping Table from SQL to sequoiadb

strow.stentry:
primary key
(Users can take any unique column as primary key.)

primary key
In Sequoiadb, primary key is automatically as the field called "_id".

section.title: Create and Alter
section.p: The following table shows create and alter statements on table level in SQL and the corresponding ones in Sequoiadb.

strow.stentry:
create table student (
id not null,
stu_id varchar(50), age number
primary key(id) )

The system will automatically generate a collection when data is firstly inserted. If the value on "_id" is not specified, the system will automatically generate a "_id" value.
db.collectionspace.student({stu_id:"01",age:20})
Of course, you can also create a collection manually
db.collectionspace.createCL("student")
alter table student add name varchar(50)

In a collection, the structure is not changable, because there is no relative manipulation to describe or change the structure. But the method update() can add new field to document record with "$set".
db.collectionspace.student.update({},{$set:{name:"Tom"}})
alter table student drop column name

In a collection, the structure is not changable, because there is no relative manipulation to describe or change the structure. But the method update() can delete existing field from document record with "$unset".
db.collectionspace.student.update({},{$unset:{name:"Tom"}})

section.title: Insert
section.p: The following table shows insert statement on table level in SQL and the corresponding one in Sequoiadb.

section.title: Select
section.p: The following table shows read statement on table level in SQL and the corresponding one in Sequoiadb.

strow.stentry: select age from student where age=25 and stu_id="01"

section.title: Update
section.p: The following table shows update statement on table level in SQL and the corresponding one in Sequoiadb.

strow.stentry: update student set age=25 where stu_id="01"
update student set age=age+2 where stu_id="01"

topic.title: Limits

strow.stentry: When document is transformed into BSON, the length should be lesser than 16777168 bytes.
It should not be started with "$". It should not contain ".".
It should not be started with "$" or "SYS". It should not contain ".".
Maximum capacity of collection consisted of single node
It is the maximum capacity of collection space
Maximum amount of collections in a collection space consisted of single node
Maximum length of collection space name
It should not be started with "$" or "SYS". It should not contain ".".
Maximum capacity of collection space consisted of single node
Maximum amount of standalone-node collection space
Maximum length of each data index key
Total length of index (It includes index name, index key, etc.) .
When an index is transformed into BSON, the length should be equal to or lesser than the size of data page minus 48 bytes.
It can contain all kinds of legal fields. But it contains at most one field which contains array.
Maximum amount of index in one collection
Maximum amount of nodes in each replset
Nodes should be created through hostname rather than IP address.
All the systems in a cluster should be able to visit each other through hostname.
Vote will not be carried out unless more than half of nodes in replset take part in it.
Each moment, only a range of data can be split in each collection.
The value of shard key is unchangable after data is inserted.
"_id" in shard collection is unique in replset, but maybe not globally unique.
It should contain all fields in sharding key.

stentry.p: Each connection object and its subobject are not thread-safe to each other. Different connections are thread-safe to each other.
